list_definition.mean_english: phồng lên, to lên, căng ra
list_definition.definition: to make or become larger, greater or thicker

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The insect-bite made her finger swell
The continual rain had swollen the river
I invited her to join us on the excursion in order to swell the numbers.

list_definition.definition: a rolling condition of the sea, usually after a storm

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The sea looked fairly calm but there was a heavy swell.

list_definition.definition: used as a term of approval

list_ex_of_english: The measurement software can determine area, perimeter, width, length and eccentricity as descriptors of changes in seed size during swelling.
Thus, in the beginning, the two pointed ends of the ligament contract to form two swells in an effort to equalize the pressure distribution.
Venous or pulmonary blood clots are often suspected in cases of leg swelling or sudden respiratory distress, but diagnosis is complicated.
After a while the procession returned and the crowd had swelled.
The ranks of producers have swelled in recent years with the advent of small, computer-based studios.
Another chorale emerges low in the strings and swells into a gloriously rich passage of immediate emotional appeal.
